root.name: match()
root.description:
The match() function is used to apply a regular expression to a piece of text, and return matching groups (elements found inside parentheses) as a String array. No match will null. If no groups are specified in the regexp, but the sequence matches, a zero length (non-null) array will be returned.
The syntax can be found in the reference for Java's Pattern class. For regular expression syntax, read the Java Tutorial on the topic.

parameter.label: regexp
parameter.description: the regexp to be used for matching
